alert.note: Alert for New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued December 18 at 12:06PM EST until December 18 at 5:22PM EST by NWS Boston
info.description: ...The National Weather Service in Boston/Norton MA has issued a Flood Warning for the following rivers in Rhode Island... Connecticut... Pawcatuck River At Westerly affecting Washington and New London Counties. ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT FROM THIS AFTERNOON TO LATE THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring. * WHERE...Pawcatuck River at Westerly. * WHEN...From this afternoon to late this afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Minor lowland flooding occurs along the Pawcatuck River. Along Route 3 in Hopkinton, floodwaters encroach on lowest lying homes in French Village. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM EST Monday the stage was 7.1 feet. - Bankfull stage is 7.0 ft. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 11:00 AM EST Monday was 7.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 6.7 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 7.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 7.1 feet on 12/01/1944. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 530 PM EST.
